meanings.definition: A person who studies the form and structure of organisms.
meanings.sent1: The morphologists carefully examine the shapes of animals.
meanings.sent2: Many morphologists work in laboratories to understand how living things are built.
meanings.sent3: The morphologists joked that they could identify an animal just by looking at its silhouette.
meanings.sent4: She had the eyes of a morphologist, noticing every detail in nature.
meanings.sent5: The group of morphologists gathered around the microscope, fascinated by the intricate patterns of cells.

meanings.definition: Those who analyze the physical characteristics of living things.
meanings.sent1: The morphologists compared the sizes of different plants in the garden.
meanings.sent2: As morphologists, they were experts in identifying unique features of organisms.
meanings.sent3: The morphologists playfully argued about which animal had the most interesting physical traits.
meanings.sent4: In her mind, she pictured the city as a playground for morphologists, exploring every detail.
meanings.sent5: The morphologists' field trip to the zoo was filled with observations of various animal characteristics.
